TopicTitle: Astronaut Complex Scene Errors, Plus Other Bonus Kerbonaut Irregularities

Articles.Content:
System Info: KSP 1.0.2 32-bit running on Windows 8.1, Steam install

Mods: Issue initially occurred while using 2 mods: EVE and KAC. After initial occurrence, symptoms persist after removal of all mods. (Hence posted in area for un-modded support. If that is incorrect, I invite a moderator to move this thread to the correct area.)

References: 

[https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/36651676/KSP/New%20folder/persistent.sfs](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/36651676/KSP/New%20folder/persistent.sfs)

[https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/36651676/KSP/New%20folder/Assigned%20Crew%20Roster.jpg](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/36651676/KSP/New%20folder/Assigned%20Crew%20Roster.jpg)

Observed Symptoms:

1a) After many hours of trouble-free gaming (save started with release of V1.0, continued through V1.0.1 and 1.0.2), crew from newly-accepted rescue contracts or on recently-launched vessels are removed from "Available" tab but not added to "Assigned" tab. 

1b) "Assigned" tab has scroll bar (which cannot actually be scrolled or manipulated in any way) despite very short displayed crew list. (see referenced .jpg screenshot)

1c) Cost of hiring next crew is listed as zero funds, but no crew can actually be hired. Note crew list states 10 kerbals out of a limit of 12 (see symptom 3 below).

2) (Actually the first symptom noticed, but of less overall import) Accepted a kerbal rescue contract, then noted that the kerbal in question was in the Mun's south polar badlands and canceled contract as more trouble than it was worth. Contract was removed, but EVA kerbal near Munar south pole remains. Kerbal is unowned and does not show up in crew listings.

3) As part of my initial efforts to fix the Astronaut Complex weirdness, I upgraded the building from level 0.5 to level 1 (fully upgraded). Astronaut Complex scene remained unchanged, including the note regarding a limit of 12 kerbals on the active roster.

At this point, I saved a copy of my persistent file, uninstalled KSP, downloaded a fresh virgin install from Steam, copied the persistent file into the new (mod-free) install, and restarted. All the above symptoms remain.

Presumably there is something wrong with my persistent file (see .sfs referenced), as that's the only thing remaining from the original appearance of the error; but the only obvious issue in the file (to my ignorant and untrained eye) is the section listing the EVA kerbal in symptom 2 (Hanwin Kerman) in the Vessels section, despite no corresponding entry in either the Contracts or Crew sections.

There are a bunch of craft in that file; of interest are the 2 craft: Rescue Ranger - Kerbin, and Rescue Ranger - Mun. Their crew (including an orange-suit!) are not listed in the Astronaut Complex roster.

Next troubleshooting step is to land and recover one of the affected craft, and see what happens to the crew. (That's going to have to wait until tomorrow, though. It's getting late.)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-19T02:57:25Z" title="05/19/2015 02:57  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 19, 2015</time> by Srpadget**
  
fix bad link

Hi Srpadget, your link to the persistent is broken, if you fix it I can try to load your save, sometimes loading a broken Windows save on Linux fixes it.

Also I have edited your thread title, this is a family friendly site so some language is not permitted.

Hey Srpadget,

It seems your persistent file is corrupted.

It is likely that one of your kerbals has a wrong "idx" value in the ROSTER section of your .sfs file. Just a single wrong idx can make a complete mess of your Astronaut Complex, usually revealed by that "*active crews:10 (max:12)*" message.

Similar symptoms and a workaround that will hopefully help you save your game are described [in this thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/119628-Broken-savegames-savegames-compatibility-troubles-with-the-Astronaut-Complex).

Cheers

sal\_vager:

A thousand apologies. I had no idea that the word in question was considered..."salty"...in ANY dialect of English. I have since gone off and gotten myself educated on the topic.

And now I'm wondering who else I have shocked/offended all unknowing over the years, with this being the first time I've ever had the issue pointed out. Because I've used that word as a deliberately-vague non-technical term meaning "unexpected and undesired behavior with as-yet-unknown root cause" for years. Decades. In less-formal BUSINESS communication. With various international corporate and government audiences. (NASA ... RSA ... ESA ... CSA ... Boeing ... Alenia ... Khrunichev ... Diehl ... etc etc etc.)

::facepalm::

(Oh well, it could be worse...I knew someone once many years ago who condescendingly told a lady she obviously didn't understand physics. Turned out she was a contractor liaison civilian employee of US Army Ballistic Missile Defense Command...and had a doctorate in physics. The guy left for another project shortly thereafter....)

- - - Updated - - -

Plume & Akakak:

My problem does indeed appear to be exactly as your link describes (including issues getting into the Astronaut Complex, though my symptom was less severe: I found I could get back into the Astronaut Complex after entering another scene (the VAB, say) then exiting back out to KSC).

And checking my persistent file (the link should be fixed now, btw), I see right at the top of the roster that Jeb's idx is wrong. I guess he's jealous that I'm giving all of "his" glamorous famous-hero missions to Val these days.... Will check (and fix as necessary) the rest of the roster. Thank goodness my kerbonaut corps is WAY smaller than yours!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-19T02:58:55Z" title="05/19/2015 02:58  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 19, 2015</time> by Srpadget**

Cleaned up a whole passel of incorrect idx's, deleted the VESSEL entry for the rejected-rescue-contract "ghost kerbal", and now my Astronaut Complex gives me correct info again! I still can't hire new crew, mind you, but now that's because I don't have enough Funds rather than because the scene is bugged! YAY!
